snippet: As thousands of protesters demanded his resignation, President Viktor F. Yanukovich seemed to brush aside the unrest and defended his refusal to sign agreements with the European Union.
abstract: Ukrainian Pres Viktor F Yanukovich defends his refusal to sign accords with the European Union even as thousands of protesters continue to demand his resignation; Yanukovich says that he is on the verge of securing lower gas prices from Russia and urges opposition to wait for presidential elections in 2015 to challenge him.
lead_paragraph: As thousands of protesters demanded his resignation, President Viktor F. Yanukovich seemed to brush aside the unrest and defended his refusal to sign agreements with the European Union.

headline.main: Amid Unrest, Ukrainian President Defends Choice on Accords
headline.print_headline: Amid Unrest, Ukrainian President Defends Choice on Accords
